text: The 1968 Paris–Tours was the 62nd edition of the Paris–Tours cycle race and was held on 6 October 1968. The race started in Paris and finished in Tours. The race was won by Guido Reybrouck. ==General classification== {| |Final general classification {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col" | Rank ! scope="col" | Rider ! scope="col" | Time |- | style="text-align:center;" | 1 | | style="text-align:right;" | |- | style="text-align:center;" | 2 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 3 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 4 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 5 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 6 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 7 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 8 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 9 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |- | style="text-align:center;" | 10 | | style="text-align:right;" | + 0" |} |} ==References== Category:1968 in French sport 1968 Category:1968 Super Prestige Pernod
